lu.uni.lassy.excalibur.examples.icrash.dev.view.gui.abstractgui

Class AbstractGUIController

  • java.lang.Object
    • lu.uni.lassy.excalibur.examples.icrash.dev.view.gui.abstractgui.AbstractGUIController
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    AbstractAuthGUIController, ActivatorGUIController, CommunicationCompanyGUIController, CreatorGUIController, MonitorGUIController

    public abstract class AbstractGUIController
extends java.lang.Object
    The Class AbstractGUIController, this has some generic functions used across several GUI windows.

    • Nested Class Summary

      The enumeration of the SliderType.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected javafx.stage.Window window
      The system window that this controller deals with, this helps making sure dialog boxes appear in front on the window and not center screen.

    • Method Detail

      • initForm

        public abstract PtBoolean initForm(JIntIsActor aActor,
                                   javafx.stage.Window window)
        Initialises the form with the default functions.
        Parameters:
        aActor - the actor that is associated with this form
        window - The window that this form is inside
        Returns:
        The success of the method

      • getSlider

        public javafx.scene.control.Slider getSlider(int width,
                                             AbstractGUIController.SliderType type,
                                             javafx.scene.control.TextField txtFldToUpdate,
                                             DtTime time)
        Generates a slider that will be used to allow the user to select a date and time.
        Parameters:
        width - The width the slider will be
        type - The type of slider, this could be hour, minute or second
        txtFldToUpdate - The text field that will update the slider or be updated by the slider changing
        time - The current system time, these are the default values to set the slider when the user sees the window for the first time
        Returns:
        The finished slider. An event will also be attached to the textfield provided

      • getDatePicker

        public javafx.scene.control.DatePicker getDatePicker(DtDate defaultDate,
                                                     int width)
        Creates a date picker that keeps the same formatting between forms.
        Parameters:
        defaultDate - The default date to set the date picker to
        width - The width to set for the date picker
        Returns:
        Returns the created datepicker

      • showOKMessage

        public void showOKMessage(java.lang.String title,
                          java.lang.String message)
        Shows a message box of the type information, this will show with a blue circle icon with a white i.
        Parameters:
        title - The title to show in a message box title bar
        message - The message to show inside the message box

      • showMessage

        private void showMessage(java.lang.String title,
                         java.lang.String message,
                         javafx.scene.control.Alert.AlertType type)
        A generic method to show message boxes, this makes sure all message boxes behave the same way.
        Parameters:
        title - The title to show in a message box title bar
        message - The message to show inside the message box
        type - The type of information box to show, an example would be information

      • showWarningMessage

        public void showWarningMessage(java.lang.String title,
                               java.lang.String message)
        Show a dialog box indicating there was an issue, this is of type warning. This shows a yellow warning triangle with a white exclamation mark
        Parameters:
        title - The title to display on the message box
        message - The message to display inside the message box

      • showWarningNoDataEntered

      • showWarningIncorrectInformationEntered

        Show the default warning if incorrect information has been entered, it requires an IncorrectFormatException class to be passed.
        Parameters:
        ex - The exception to get the message details from

      • checkIfAllDialogHasBeenFilledIn

        public boolean checkIfAllDialogHasBeenFilledIn(javafx.scene.layout.GridPane grdpn)
        Checks the gridpane and all the controls inside and sees if they have data entered. Currently checks the following controls: Textfield ComboBox TextArea DatePicker
        Parameters:
        grdpn - The girdpane and it's controls to check
        Returns:
        Returns true if all values checked have been filled in
